verbose_text: Transforming growth factor-beta (TGF-beta) has an immune suppression function and can downregulate secretion of inflammatory factors such as TNF-alpha, IL-1, and IFN-gamma, as well as playing a critical role in mediating osteoblast proliferation / differentiation [XREF_BIBR] and apoptosis [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: Transforming growth factor-beta (TGF-beta) has an immune suppression function and can downregulate secretion of inflammatory factors such as TNF-alpha, IL-1, and IFN-gamma
